Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder and neck section of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is encrusted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed and with the base of one handle surviving, is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of a black-painted text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394450) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394450)
